result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey A. Beckman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: 1st Degree Child Sexual Assault - Intercourse with Person under 12

superMiscConds.notes:
NO contact with anyone under the age of 18.  

May NOT volunteer or work in jobs involving minor children. 

May NOT possess a computer except if necessary for employment.

DNA sample.  

Register with Sex Offender Program and follow all rules.

Atty Wetzsteon makes sentence argument.
Atty Rotter makes sentence argument.
OTR: 10:26 am
BOTR: 10:39 am
Deft makes statement.

COURT ORDERS: COUNTS 5 & 6> 3 years IC & 8 years ES to run CONSECUTIVE to each other: CONDITIONS: Register with Sex Offender Progam and follow all rules; No contact with anyone under the age of 18; May not volunteer or work in jobs involving minor children; may not possess a computer except if necessary for employment; $500 surcharge for each image; CC; DNA sample and surcharge.

COUNTS 7-17> 3 years IC & 8 years ES to run CONCURRENT with each other and COUNT 5> CONDITIONS: Register with Sex Offender Progam and follow all rules; No contact with anyone under the age of 18; May not volunteer or work in jobs involving minor children; may not possess a computer except if necessary for employment; $500 surcharge for each image; CC; DNA sample and surcharge.

COURT notes deft has 639 days credit; Deft is not eligible for SAP & CIP; Attys will retain copies of PSI.

Case called: 9:21am
State appears by ADA T.Wetzsteon; Defendant appears in person/in custody and with Attorney Peter Rotter.
(FPT and Continuation of MH from 7/14/15)

State notes issue on proceeding on DA's office exhibiting type of evidence that will be used - Atty Rotter states agreement and COURT signs order.
State also notes WPD will provide computer for trial for purposes of viewing evidence during trial.
Discussion by parties re: gallery viewing evidence/exhibits - Attorney Rotter requesting time to respond on that issue; COURT grants.
Discussion re: Judge viewing exhibits/evidence - COURT makes ruling.
Atty Rotter states Daubert hearing needed regarding Det Buckner as expert - COURT directs parties to wait  until receipt of additional report, and parties to file argument in writing no later than 2 weeks prior to start of trial on that issue; COURT will then issue ruling.
State requests exhibits with images be retained by WPD after being received by court during/after trial - Argument by Atty Rotter; COURT reserves ruling on that issue at a later date.
COURT addresses number of jurors/alternates; Parties agree on 50 jurors to be called w/one alternate w/ind. voir dire if necessary.
Atty Rotter requests cut off date for discovery/additional reports and information - COURT sets deadline for any additional discovery for 7/22/15.
COURT orders jury instructions to be filed by both parties at least one week prior to start of trial.

Adj: 9:47am

Jury Trial at 08-18-2015 08:30 am.
